name: One Great Cheesecake
author: cc663
summary: This is a variation on other cheesecake recipes that I have found here and incorporates 'suggestions' from the comments sections. I wanted to consolidate it all into 1 recipe. I have had great comments on this version and personally I believe it is absolutely delish.
ingredients: ¾ cup Irish cream liqueur (such as Baileys®)
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease a 9-inch springform pan and wrap the bottom in 2 layers of aluminum foil
Mix graham crackers, melted butter, sugar, and cinnamon together in a bowl
Add more butter if the mixture seems dry
Press mixture into the bottom of the prepared springform pan
Mix cream cheese and sugar together in a large bowl until smooth
Mix in sour cream, flour, and vanilla extract until batter is smooth
Place filled springform pan into a large, deep baking pan
Add 1 inch of very hot water to the outer pan
Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour
Turn off oven and leave cake in the closed oven for 2 hours to cool completely
Chill in the refrigerator before serving, about 1 hour
